text: Out of curiosity, how did the Leo Frishberg event come about?
I'd like for us to figure out a way to get more engaging speakers, and ones that folks are excited about seeing. Tonight was a pretty sad turnout.
Leo and I had met a while back during the Intel layoffs. He, Ewald, and I had a follow up chat, and I thought he'd be worthwhile to have present. (I didn't know he'd take book reading so literally).
Heh, yeah I think that was the main thing.

Yeah I'm going to take a more active role in finding and bringing speakers in for thread. I think we can and should have non-thread things, but make anything thread as special as possible and ideally related (even tangentially). That's the whole point
And so wait: he literally read from his book?!
Yup
That's so strange. His whole deal with us was interactive discussion
Almost absurdly interactive discussion
I also think some sort of sounds system for these events would be great, less for three speaker, more for the guests entering the space and mingling beforehand.
He read excerpts and then asked if there were reactions
Huh
There were several comments that were invariably answered with further excerpts.
So, while his book and approach seemed interesting, it felt like he was just trying to sell some books
Anywho, this is all to say: let's make the next thread awesome!
We'll certainly try, with the caveat that it's a roll of the dice
He seemed interesting when we met
Of course- it's also partly drumming up enthusiasm internally, and externally thru social channels, etc. Giving people more lead time will probably lead to better turnouts
Agreed
Late to the combo but also wanted to add that I would love to help in any way I can. Felt like the social media comms may have gone out a bit late on this one. Happy to help on the next one.
On the plus side, stephanies snack game was on point
^^^ Agreed.
Wasnâ€™t able to be there but got a preview this AM :wink:
Noted on all fronts
yeah i felt we were well prepared to host and the setup was top notch
bummed that he took the book reading literally, esp. when we suggested a brief reading, q&a, then discussion
